TopicTitle: ksp for xbox and ps4 hate

Articles.Content: personally im glad the ksp is coming to xbox one and ps4 rather than just ps4 or just pc. at first i was kinda mad that they where only making ksp for ps4 and not both ps4 and xbox one but i assumed that was because of the fact the ps4 could probably handle ksp better then the xbox one could, but sense ksp is coming to xbox one there is alot of hate in the ksp community about it for some reason i guess its maybe because most of ksps fans are ps4 fans but i dont really know and it seems that there are alot more dislikes and mean comments in the youtube announcement video about it...i guess thought the ksp community was better then this
I think it is safe to assume that most KSP players don't care about both xbox or ps4.

People are oddly passionate about console choice, which is something that as a PC person, I can only shake my head at. To me, they're just shades of the same color, in a phrase.

Personally, I think having KSP on as many different consoles as possible is a great idea. More people get to experience this great game that way, and I can't see anything wrong with that.

My friend, if you are using YouTube comments for...well, anything then you are in for a hard time.

It seems to me that there are a handful of people who seem to be really upset by the console announcements (and are saying so a lot), but most players seem to be apathetic about it. After all, we all already play KSP, and it going to consoles adds very little for us.

What makes it interesting is it makes KSP accessible to thousands of more potential players, and also shows commitment on Squad's part to the Kerbal universe. Plus, as long as people are still buying KSP I expect development will continue; I dread the day when sales taper off enough that it is no longer economically viable to continue that development. So expanding to other markets is a good thing, even if we (as existing KSP players) are not part of that market.

No hate here, ignore the pc snobs, and form your own opinion. btw, has anyone seen my beer?

EDIT: I dont mean to be derisive, i am quite drunk

Carry on KSP folks

I dont get the hate really I mean its foundations..

"Exclusive" titles were a pretty bad way to forcibly make people who wanted to play certain games loyal to that platform.... Ive oftern thought about the good old days when most games were on every platform back in the 80s.. these were games that became well known and stood the test of time. Elite, Defender.. etc

The majority of "haters" for each platform for the most part I think lies with the age of the commenter, due to being young having the inability to buy there own systems .. eg.. stuck with whatever system their parents brought.. while more mature age games alot of the times have both or quite a nice selection..

Theres no threat to KSP with porting over to consoles, especially in this generation of hardware.. as the consoles are just PCs in their own way only simplified in terms of hardware.. so thus.. easier to code for.. the flagship version will keep being PC..

im a former windows user that out of need started using linux.. KSP runs wonderfully on that.. and my rig is way under specifications (2gb ram and no loading crashes while having mods installed..unlike windows) im quite happy I didnt have to deal with windows 7 etc .. choice is good.. im sure the linux version got the same hate from windows users screaming murder that it'll harm their version too..

windows is still quite buggy but .. the change to unity 5 benefits windows and console.. the later being a nice reason to persue change that benefits all

Multiple platforms is a good thing.. it gives people choice.. helps broaden the appeal.. and most of all.. exposure of the game to a wider audience..
